poem:
Title: "Unborn Dreams in Ash and Shadow"

Under the impassive silent skies,
4,000 unmade worlds lie broken.
Scattered, they sleep in the womb of rubble-
hope razed by unseen booms.
Hormone pricks, anaesthesia whispers,
all, echo in hollow rooms.
What dreams were inked in cold embryo,
frozen stories of love sublime,
now dust in Gaza, embryonic chimes
ring in the heart's crushing sorrow.
